intro: Cecropia tolimensis, commonly known as the Tolima Cecropia, is a species of tree native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and distinctive, hollow stems. The plant is often found in humid, tropical forests and thrives in areas with high rainfall. It plays an important role in the ecosystem as a host plant for various insect species. Its rapid growth rate makes it a notable component of secondary forests and regenerating vegetation.
